result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian M Antoniak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine and costs.  Paid in full.  Balance to be refunded to poster.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Wisconsin State Patrol.  Cash bail applied.  Paid in full.
  Transcript fee paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to District Attorney.  Cash bail applied.  Paid in full.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  Cash bail applied.  Paid in full.

Huber with standard release conditions. Credit 7 days. Commencing FORTHWITH.

10/12/2017 - ATC GRADUATE.  JAIL PORTION IS MODIFIED FROM 120 DAYS TO ACTUAL TIME SERVED IN CUSTODY OF 52 DAYS.  ANY REMAINING JAIL TIME IS PERMANENTLY VACATED.
06/07/18 COURT AMENDS THE DL REVOCATION FROM 36 MONTHS TO 24 MONTHS DUE TO GRADUATE OF ATC PROGRAM.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform alcohol assessment and follow through.
ATTEND Victim Impact Panel on 06-22-2016 or serve 20 days Huber, consecutive, for failure to attend.

To be completed within 1 year.  To be monitored through WCS.

3/13/17 - COURT COMBINES THE 75 HOURS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE ON THIS CASE WITH THE 100 HOURS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE ORDERED ON 16CF316, FOR A TOTAL OF 175 HOURS.  ALL HOURS TO BE MONITORED BY WCS.

4/6/2017 - COURT ORDERS DEFENDANT TO PERFORM A TOTAL OF 100 HOURS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE FOR CASES 16CF316 AND 15CM1869.

It is hereby ordered, that on 5/3/16 at 9:30 a.m. the above named defendant, as an ATC participant, be released to Wisconsin Community Services for placement on the SCRAM monitoring system until further order of the Court.
Letter from ProHealthcare
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brian M Antoniak in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.   The defendant was sentenced to the following:

HUBER:  120 days, w/Standard Release Conditions (Credit - 7 Days). Defendant remanded into custody and sentence to begin forthwith..

FINE: $1544.00 (apply cash bail from 15CM1869 and 15CM2010);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00, (apply cash bail from 15CM2010);  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Wisconsin State Patrol (apply cash bail from15CM2010).

OTHER: TRANSCRIPT FEE  $20.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to District Attorney (apply cash bail from 15CM2010).

D/L REVOCATION: 36 months;

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months;

COMMUNITY SERVICE: Perform 75 Hours within one year to be monitored by WCS.

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  6/22/16. Defendant to serve 20 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

There is a possibility that the Defendant will apply for alcohol treatment court.  The Court adjourns the trial and sets both cases for plea and sentencing. The State objects to the bail modification.  The Court denies the motion and bail remains as set.  The Court sests the matter for trial and removes the November 23, 2015 hearing from the calendar.

Hearing at 10-23-2015 09:30 am

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Brian M Antoniak in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
